title: Best Open Source Audio Ai AI Tools - Top Picks for 2025
metaDescription: Discover the 6 best open source audio ai AI tools in 2025. Compare features, pricing & reviews to find the perfect tool for your needs.
introduction: Looking for the best open source audio ai AI tools in 2025? We've analyzed hundreds of tools to bring you this curated list of the top 6 options. Whether you're a developer, business, or individual user, this guide helps you choose the right open source audio ai AI tool.

platforms.name: OpenAI Whisper
platforms.description: OpenAI Whisper is an open-source automatic speech recognition (ASR) system that transcribes and translates speech from audio across dozens of languages. It is designed to be robust to accents, background noise, and technical language, making it highly versatile. Its unique value lies in being a state-of-the-art, general-purpose model that is freely available for both research and commercial use, trained on a massive and diverse 680,000-hour dataset.
keyFeatures: Speech translation from non-English languages to English
Robust performance in noisy environments and with diverse accents

platforms.name: Kaldi
platforms.description: Kaldi is an open-source speech recognition toolkit designed for both research and production environments. It provides a comprehensive framework for building speech recognition systems with state-of-the-art techniques, featuring extensive support for custom acoustic and language model training. What makes Kaldi unique is its robust C++ core with efficient WFST-based decoding, extensive documentation of research methods, and its role as a foundational codebase that has influenced many commercial and academic speech systems.
keyFeatures: WFST-based decoder for efficient speech recognition
Extensive C++ library for speech processing algorithms
Support for DNN, TDNN, and CNN acoustic models

platforms.name: AudioCraft
platforms.description: AudioCraft is Meta's open-source AI toolkit for generating high-quality, realistic audio from text descriptions. It provides specialized models for music (MusicGen), sound effects (AudioGen), and audio compression/editing (EnCodec), enabling users to synthesize, manipulate, and enhance audio programmatically. Its unique value lies in being a comprehensive, research-grade framework released by Meta, offering state-of-the-art, pre-trained models that are freely available for both research and commercial use.
keyFeatures: MusicGen: A 3.3B parameter model for generating music from text descriptions or melodic conditioning
AudioGen: A 1.5B parameter model for generating environmental sound effects and audio from text
EnCodec: A real-time neural audio codec for high-fidelity, low-bitrate audio compression and representation

platforms.name: Riffusion 2.0
platforms.description: Riffusion 2.0 is a next-generation AI platform for generating and manipulating audio using latent diffusion models. It enables users to create high-quality music, sound effects, and ambient audio from text descriptions or even visual spectrogram images, and offers powerful style transfer and audio remixing capabilities. Its unique approach of operating in a latent 'mel-spectrogram' space allows for intricate control and high-fidelity output, setting it apart from raw waveform generators.
keyFeatures: Text-to-Audio Generation: Create music and soundscapes from detailed natural language prompts (e.g., 'lo-fi beats with rain and piano').
Image-to-Audio Generation: Upload or generate a spectrogram image to synthesize corresponding audio, bridging visual and auditory domains.
Audio Style Transfer & Remixing: Apply the musical style of one audio clip to the content of another for mashups and new compositions.

platforms.name: OpenVoice v2 (by MyShell)
platforms.description: The next generation of the popular instant voice cloning technology. This open-source release offers even higher fidelity, emotional tone control, and cross-lingual capabilities, allowing for realistic voice synthesis in real-time.
keyFeatures: Granular control over tone, emotion, accent

platforms.name: OpenVoice 2
platforms.description: The next generation of instant voice cloning and real-time voice synthesis. It offers improved emotional control, zero-shot multilingual capabilities, and ultra-realistic, low-latency voice generation.
keyFeatures: Instant voice cloning from short samples
Granular control over tone, emotion, and accent
